key_title: Key to the species of Elytrigia

source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Poaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: From: Walsh, N.G. (1994). Poaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Leaf-blades stiff, often inrolled, sharp-pointed and glabrous; auricles not well-developed (up to c. 1 mm long); glumes obtuse to acute; lemmas awnless, thick and rigid; plants usually quite glaucous, mostly coastal

Leaf-blades flat, hairy on the upper surface; auricles usually well-developed and partly encircling stem (mostly >1 mm long); glumes acute to shortly awned; lemmas usually shortly awned, firm but not thick; plants green, generally non-coastal
